Creating a Project

You can create a project on any StarTeam server configuration, as long as your workstation has access to that server and you have been granted the rights needed to create projects in that location.

When you create a project, you must provide a project name and designate a working folder location for the project's root (initial) folder. The initial view of the project is created at the same time you create the project. It has the same name as the project, although you can change the name later if you choose. The root folder is also created at this time.

If your workstation is not currently set up to access the server on which the project will reside, you can add access to that server as part of creating the project.

Projects can be created by dragging folders from your workstation to StarTeam or by using the Create Project Wizard.

To create a project:

  1. From My Computer or Microsoft Explorer on your workstation, choose a folder that you would like to use as the basis of a StarTeam project.

  2. Select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name.

  3. Drag the folder from your workstation to the main StarTeam window. Alternatively, you can select Project > New from the menu, or click the New Project button on the Project toolbar. Any of these actions will open the New Project Wizard.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Select a server configuration for the project from the server list, and click Next to continue.

    • Click Add Server to add access to the server configuration on which you wish to locate the project. See Adding a Server Configuration.

  5. After you have selected a server, the New Project Wizard: Project Name dialog opens. When it appears:

    1. Enter the name of the project in the Project Name text box.

    2. Enter a description of the project and click Next to continue. The New Project Wizard: Working Folder dialog opens.

    3. Enter or browse for the default working folder on your workstation that will be used for the project root folder. If the working folder does not exist, StarTeam will create it.

      4. Important: The default working folder must point to a location that is physically discrete for each user, such as a drive on that user's workstation or a personal directory on a shared file server.

    4. Click Next. The New Project Wizard: Child Folders dialog opens.

    5. (Optional) If the working folder has child folders, you can include or exclude those folders from the StarTeam folder. If desired, select the folders to be removed from the project and click Exclude. Click Reset to re-list excluded folders.

    6. Click Finish to complete and open the project.

    Note: After you create a project, the left pane of the project view window displays the hierarchy of folders in the current view of the project. You can add additional folders, if desired. Files must be added as a separate operation. See Adding Files to a Project.
